jobDescription: Construction Equipment - Technical Training Manager Location  Bronx, NY Department  Human ResourcesApply Now Job Brief  Now hiring for a Technical Training Manager - looking for a talented individual with experience managing the training function and experience working on / with Construction Equipment.H.O. Penn Machinery, the Caterpillar Dealer for New York Metro and all of Connecticut is looking for a  talented and experienced Construction Equipment - Technical Training Manager to join their team. *This position can be based out of any of our five locations:(Poughkeepsie NY, Bronx NY, Bloomingburg NY, Holtsville NY, or Newington CT) Reporting to the Director of Employee & Organizational Development, you would be responsible for the following: Oversee technical training of technician workforce to improve performance and productivity Identify technical training needs of individual technicians and the organization overall  Manage the development of Individual Learning Plans for technicians at all levels  Oversee planning and scheduling of technical training based on prioritization of needs  Manage the delivery of technical training through multiple sources  Personally deliver training as needed Support on-going development of employees for growth and stability Work with internal partners to evaluate on the job application of technical concepts  Manage and report on both quantitative and qualitative metrics for all technical training programs  Review and ensure that all equipment (electrical, electronics, mechanical, etc.) required for training is available Manage the overall growth and maintenance of H.O. Penn as an industry leader/technical resource Ensure all personnel are kept abreast of technological advances through New Product Updates and Introductions  Coordinate customer training by identifying training needs and ensuring delivery when appropriate  Work with Corporate Recruiter to establish a recruiting strategy and assist in technician recruitment  Work with Technical/Vocational schools to develop relationships to contribute to the technical recruitment effort Staff and develop people Build & maintain environment characterized by high productivity and high morale  Effectively manage employee performance  Develop people to consistently achieve or exceed job expectations QualificationsStrong Technical acumen with experience as a Construction Equipment technician requiredExperience in management of the training function requiredManagement or supervisory experience preferredDemonstrated ability to prioritize tasks effectively, manage projects, and work with multiple stakeholders to assess needs and deliver solutionsExperience in design and delivery of training: Strong communication, presentation, writing, analysis, & organizational skills are requiredProficiency in PC use, including MS Office & ability to learn new PC applications is requiredMust possess a valid driver’s license and be able to travel regularly (some overnight) We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
